intro: Steiropteris praetervisa, commonly known as the Philippine tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in tropical rainforests. Its rhizome system supports the growth of its tall stem, while the fronds are used for both ornamental and traditional purposes. Steiropteris praetervisa plays a vital role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and contributing to forest biodiversity.
